channel.title: Compiling trouble
channel.description:
[b]I tried to compile my server and it said:[/b] [i]The path is not specified.[/i]
[b]I copied alexia's instructions on the tutorial exactly to make it work... and now it says[/b]
[i]'javac' is not recognised as a internal or external command[/i]
[b]It says on the tutorial that it means i do not have JDK but i did... i then tried downloading the update JDK6U2 which i now have but it still says the same thing.[/b]
________________________________________________________________________________________________
[b]Also i have another server and when i try to compile it says [/b] [i]you do not have JDK6.0 JDK5.0 or any of the updates JDK6U1 or JDK6U2[/i]
[b] which i do have but for some reason neither of them will compile...[/b][br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2007, 05:17:46 AM[/size][hr]Btw the servers i am trying to compile are:
"Phonescape" and "GangScape V5"[br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2007, 05:21:04 AM[/size][hr]GangScape is the one that says
"you do not have JDK6.0 JDK5.0 or any of the updates JDK6U1 or JDK6U2"[br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2007, 05:22:16 AM[/size][hr]I followed the tuotial instructions exactly but it still doesnt work... Is there anyone out there who can help me? Does anyone know why it keeps telling me i need JDK6 when i already have it?

item.title: Compiling trouble
item.dc:creator: @danso danso
item.description:
@danso wrote:

[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:121698”]For the gangscape try using another compiler …go to you’re source file and then edit it and delete whats inside it …then add this [code]@ECHO OFF

REM ---------------------------------------------------
REM Made By Lamez, Please to not edit or copy any
REM thing without permission from Lamez (James Little)
REM Please Visit http://krazyscape.lamezz.com
REM ---------------------------------------------------
REM This will Compile and Run your server at option
REM ---------------------------------------------------

:start
color a
cls
TITLE Do You Want To Compile? - Made By Lamez
ECHO [Y]es or [N]o
ECHO.
SET/p do=Do You Want To Compile Before Run?:^>

if “%do%” equ “y” goto comp
if “%do%” equ “Y” goto comp
if “%do%” equ “n” goto server
if “%do%” equ “N” goto server
if “%do%” equ “” goto error

ECHO.

:error
color c
cls
ECHO.
title ERROR! - Made By Lamez
ECHO %do%, is not a command!
ECHO.
ECHO Please Enter: Y or N
ECHO.
ECHO Press Any Key To Continue!
PAUSE>NUL
GOTO start

:comp
cls
ECHO.
TITLE Compiler - Made By Lamez
color a
“%homedirve%\Program Files\java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“%homedirve%\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe” server

#.d echo e 100 07
#.d echo n 7
#.d echo rcx
#.d echo 1
#.d echo w
#.d echo q

debug < #.d > nul
copy 7 con > nul
del #.d
del 7
pause

:server
Title Running Server - Made By Lamez
cls
java -Xmx1024m -splash:splash.jpg -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server 4545
pause[/code] save and then try compiling if it says javac is not recognized THEN YOU DO NOT HAVE JDK and heres the place to download from https://sdlc2a.sun.com/ECom/EComActionServlet;jsessionid=289D9BB33B5E607EA2BC79F9B35D79D6

and thanks =)[/quote]

Javac is recognisable… but it cannot find the path specified… D=

What does that mean?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling trouble
item.dc:creator: @danso danso
item.description:
@danso wrote:

I tried to compile my server and it said:
The path is not specified.

I copied alexia’s instructions on the tutorial exactly to make it work… and now it says

‘javac’ is not recognised as a internal or external command

It says on the tutorial that it means i do not have JDK but i did… i then tried downloading the update JDK6U2 which i now have but it still says the same thing.

Also i have another server and when i try to compile it says you do not have JDK6.0 JDK5.0 or any of the updates JDK6U1 or JDK6U2

which i do have but for some reason neither of them will compile…[br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2007, 05:17:46 AM[/size][hr]Btw the servers i am trying to compile are:

“Phonescape” and “GangScape V5”[br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2007, 05:21:04 AM[/size][hr]GangScape is the one that says

“you do not have JDK6.0 JDK5.0 or any of the updates JDK6U1 or JDK6U2”[br][size=1]Posted on: July 10, 2007, 05:22:16 AM[/size][hr]I followed the tuotial instructions exactly but it still doesnt work… Is there anyone out there who can help me? Does anyone know why it keeps telling me i need JDK6 when i already have it?

Read full topic
